Messages.Author: Frowin Leonard Buballa
Messages.Content: Dear students,  the registration for the first timeslots, available on the 28.08.2024, will open up tomorrow (28.06.) at 4 pm (https://isis.tu-berlin.de/mod/organizer/view.php?id=1784112) You can either register for your presentation with your group (please make sure, that your group is available at the selected timeslot!) or even an oral exam, if you want to do just that or both on the same day. We recommend doing your presentation first and the exam later.  This is NOT the only available date, there will be additional options in end of September/start of October which will be announced on time.  Since you cannot add comments during the registration process, Please add a comment during your registration or send me a mail if you register for an exam or your presentation. If you have any more questions or something is not working as intended, please don't hesitate to send me a mail.  Kind regards Frowin Buballa

Messages.Author: Frowin Leonard Buballa
Messages.Content: Apparently you can add comments after selecting a time slot. Therefore, you can also add a comment if this is your presentation/exam instead of writing me a mail.  Kind regards Frowin Buballa

Messages.Author: Frowin Leonard Buballa
Messages.Content: Please also add a phone number (as comment/mail to me), in case there is a short notice change of schedule. The number (just as the comments) can only be seen by me/Prof. Gerfers/our secretary.

Messages.Author: Frowin Leonard Buballa
Messages.Content: Dear students,  I added more timeslots for the 28th of august. I also disabled the waiting list and canceled 2 appointments, where I had no information if they were for exam or presentation. So please check if everything is as expected.  If there is a problem, please let me know  kind regards Frowin Buballa

Messages.Author: Frowin Leonard Buballa
Messages.Content: Dear students,  I corrected the stuff you handed in from practice1 to homework3, directly in ISIS. Please check If I counted your points correct or if there is something unclear why I deducted points. If you find something or want to discuss something with my, come by my office or write me a mail till the 17.07.2024  Kind regards Frowin Buballa

Messages.Author: Friedel Gerfers
Messages.Content: Dear AAIC attendees, I was able to get 2-3 extra seats for the exchange program. Its promised but needs confirmation by Taiwan council. Final acceptance is also done by the Taiwan council.Thus I can only help, but I do not decide who will be finally selcted. If you are interested, please provide the following asap, send to me my email 1) print out of grades 2) courses attended / finished related to microelectronics & circuit design 3) please indicate if mid July to mid Sept would be ok You must be master student. BA are not accpeted, sorry. Cost coverage is really great.

Messages.Author: Friedel Gerfers
Messages.Content: Dear AAIC attendees, Frowin will back me up and holds the lecture at our usual time slot. Friedel Gerfers

Messages.Author: Friedel Gerfers
Messages.Content: Dear AAIC attendees,  here are all the info I have. Please see attached PDFs. and the following link https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScZ92A8cjB_gGG_kwxmX6fVUb2fPQMP-ib1V8vQj8yJTYHx6w/viewform I am not aware if there is a selction process in place or "first come first sereve". I hope to get more info in Singapure. I keep you posted.  Bests Friedel Gerfers

Messages.Author: Frowin Leonard Buballa
Messages.Content: Dear students,  since the question came up now a couple of times, if "dcOpInfo" does not show up in your results browser, you probably need the check the box "Save Operating Point" for your DC-simulation   Kind regards Frowin Buballa

Messages.Author: Frowin Leonard Buballa
Messages.Content: Dear students,  rights now there is room for 14 groups and 30 students in EN414, because of this there will only be one time-slot (12-14 after the lecture) for the cadence introduction next week. If there are more students or more groups registered by next week, I will offer a second introduction from 14-16.  Kind regards Frowin Buballa

Messages.Author: Frowin Leonard Buballa
Messages.Content: Dear students,  please remember to register via MOSES (MTS --> Modulprüfungen --> Anmelden --> follow the instructions) for the course (#41178 Advanced Analog Integrated Circuits and Systems (AAIC) (12LP)), till tuesday the 07.05.2024  some people asked me if they have to register as Pflichtmodul or Wahlpflichtmodul. From my understanding you have to register as a Pflichtmodul if you want AAIC to count towards your Schwerpunkt/Vertiefung (36LP) and register as Wahlpflicht if you want to use AAIC towards your general Fak. IV master-module (24LP). However please make sure with the Prüfungsamt if this is correct!  Kind regards Frowin Buballa

Messages.Author: Friedel Gerfers
Messages.Content: Dear AAIC attendees,  the first lecture on Wednesday 17th April will start at 10.15am. See you then. Bests Friedel Gerfers

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Also searching for a group partner

Messages.Author: Jan Stefan Remy
Messages.Content: Hello everyone, I am also searching for a group partner. I would like to keep it open, whether to extend the project into the semester break. I am currently in group aaic2, so if you are interested, you can just join or contact me via isis. Best regards Jan

Messages.Author: Laurin Angel
Messages.Content: Hello everyone, I'm also searching for a group partner for the project. I completed AIC last semester, so I still have a good grasp of the cadence concepts. Unlike Alja, I prefer to extend the lab presentation into the lecture-free period if possible. Feel free to contact me via ISIS or mail (angel@tu-berlin.de). Best regards, Laurin

Messages.Author: Katharina Schäpers
Messages.Content: Hi, I still need a Partner too. I didn't do AIC yet but I have no time pressure so can extend the lab.  best regards Katharina

Messages.Author: Aljaz Secko
Messages.Content: Hey guys, I am looking for a group partner. I should mention, that I am an Erasmus student, which means, I need (hope) to finish the project this semester. So, if anyone is in the same situation, please don't hesitate to say so. Kind regards, Alja :)
